The rumble of the crowd that had gathered gave me a constant reminder that Konoha was one of the largest villages in all of the Elemental Nations. Ino stood next to me, along with Naruto andSakura, while Jiraiya, Kakashi and Shizune stood behind us. The Council Elders were currently giving their speech, approaching the part wher they would announce Naruto's appointment and my own. Although Naruto was putting on a brave face, I can honestly say I've never seen him this nervous!

"Hey Naruto, take it easy. Stressing'll only make it worse." I said, nudging him. Naruto let out a deep breath.

"Easy for you to say, Takeshi. You're not about to become Hokage, Mr Sword God." he replied sarcastically. I laughed a bit at Naruto using my nickname again. Since a few month's ago, I found out that I was featured in the bingo books over all the Elemental Nation, with most of them having given my the nickname "The Sword God". I have to admit I was a bit surprised, but Iliked the title right away.

"Listen, you'll be fine. After all, you've got the future Mrs Uzumaki here, right?" I said, grinning. Certainly, few were surprised when Naruto proposed to Sakura about a month ago. We all knew it would happen eventually (although I did try to help Naruto get it over and done with before the ceremony).

"I guess you're right." he replied, gripping Sakura's hand. She smiled at him sweetly, both of them off in their own little world.

"Sephiroth, you think I should?" I asked.

"Yes. It's clear you both deeply love each other, you might as well ask her now." he replied.

"Right, thanks." I replied, just as the Council announced who would succeed Tsunade, the crowd cheering at hearing Naruto's name. The council motioned for Naruto to step forward, which he did.

"Naruto Uzumaki, do you swear to protect this village, with your life if need be?"

"I do."

"Do you swear by the honor of our village's name to lead us to the best of your ability, to serve it with the best of intentions?"

"I do."

"Then by the power given to the Council, we hereby pass the title of Hokage down to you." they said, placing the hat on Naruto's head. "Congratulations, Sixth Hokage." The crowd cheered even louder than before, the noise almost deafening now. Naruto stepped forward to make his speech to the people.

"...people of Konoha...I stand here today...honored." he began, "I spent my life, living for this moment. The moment to finally achieve the highest honor a ninja of Konoha can achieve...many of you may know this, having personally met me..."

The people fell silent, listening to his every word.

"Some of you may have doubted me in the past...though I suppose many of you are the reason I got to this point today..."

Ino looked at me, smiling warmly. I put a hand on her shoulder, a small comforting gesture. She put her hand over mine, as Naruto continued.

"I will be the first to admit that my life was nothing to brag about...but I always believed that if I continued to strive and work for what I believed in that someday I would achieve my dream..."

"I promise that as long as I serve as Hokage that I will do all that I can to insure its peace and prosperity. I promise that I will look into the local issues, as well as those involving foreign affairs. I will do all that I can to bring Konoha into the greatest era it has seen yet."

"People of the Leaf Village, I know that many of you are aware of what I hold within me. Many of you may hold a grudge against me for it...but I will tell you right now, I have it under control. As of today, I lift the law created by the Third Hokage, and the secret of me being a Jinchuuriki is no more. I will not hold this secret any longer. If I am to be Hokage, then the first thing I must do is have my people's trust."

"My father had entrusted me with that burden when I was first born. I do not wish to tarnish that trust he had in me by hiding the truth from all of you. I am the container of the Nine-tailed Fox, but nothing more. I can use it's powers, but only to a certain degree. Will the fox take over me? No. Will the fox be the death of me. Not likely. Does my status as a Jinchuuriki affect the village at all? Without a doubt...but I will not let this fact be our doom. I am strong not because of the Nine Tailed Fox, but because of how hard I have worked to become the shinobi I am today..."

"To me...all of you are my family. Only recently have I found out of my lineage...but I still see all of this village as a part of who I am, and what I am. It's because of all of you that I am what I am today. It is because of this village that I want our children...and our children's children to have the opportunity to lead successful lives of their own. Again...I promise all of you that as long as I am Hokage, I will do all I can to insure this village's peace and prosperity. That is a promise...and I never go back on my word...for that is my nindo!" he finished. For a short while, there was an eerie silience, before it was ubruptly broken.

Then Kiba let out a hooting cheer, "Yeah, Naruto!!" With that, the village burst into applause, cheers and shouting reaching insane volumes. Naruto grinned so wide I thought his face would split. Then, the Council members stepped forward once more.

"All right, showtime!" I thought, as they spoke.

"In addition to Naruto's appointment as Hokage, we have one further announcement. As of this day, the title of Sannin will be an official ninja rank, and we have already chosen a ninja who has proved himself more than worthy." they said, motioning in my direction. Nervously, I stepped forward, into the crowd's view.

"People of the Leaf Village, we present to you the first official Sannin, Takeshi Hatake!" Once again, the villagers erupted into cheers, with my father joining in as well. Smiling, I motioned for Ino to join me, as the village fell silent again.

"People of the Leaf, thank you very much for your kindness. If I may, I have an announcement of my own to make." I then turned to face Ino, going down on one knee. I heard many of the villagers gasp in surprise.

"Ino, when I first met you, I felt something that I thought I would never feel again in my heart. You have been so supportive throughout everything I've been through, throughout these two long years. Ino Yamanaka, will you marry me?" I aslked, pulling out the ring I'd bought two months earlier. It was a simple golden ring, with a small topaz set in it, the Leaf Village symbol carved into it. Ino put her hands to her mouth, tears running down her cheeks, as she gasped in shock. Suddenly she grabbed my hand with both of hers, smiling joyfully.

"Yes! Of course I'll marry you, Takeshi!" she cried. I stood back up, sliding the ring onto her left hand, as the village cheered once more.

Later, the Hokage's Office

An hour later, myself, Shizune, Ino, Sakura, Naruto and Kakashi were gathered in the Hokage's (Naruto's) office. Ino hadn't let go of me since the ceremony, still clinging to my arm while admiring her ring. Mean while, Naruto kept fiddling with his hat, constantly adjusting it.

"Naruto quit messing around with the hat, will ya?" Sakura asked. Naruto chuckled, before doing as she said.

"Sorry Sakura, I'm just excitied. I can't believe it's finally happened." he replied. I smirked.

"Yeah well, just remember. I might be your right-hand man now, but don't expect me to bail you out if you screw up, all right?" I said.

"Don't worry, he's got me for that." Sakura replied. Everyone including myself laughed loudly, before Ino turned to face me.

"Takeshi, now that we're engaged, there's something I need to tell you." she said.

"What is it?" I asked. Ino looked conflicted, as if unsure of what to say, or rather, how to say it.

"Well, I...I'm pregnant, Takeshi." she said quietly. Everyone was shocked, while Ino looked sad.

"R-Really?" I stuttered, trying to recover my wits after the bombshell my future wife had just dropped.

"I-I'm sorry..." she sobbed, before I cut her off with a kiss.

"That's great, Ino! We're gonna be parents!" I cried. Ino looked up at me in astonishment.

"You're not mad?"

"How could I be? I love you, remember? So, how long?" I asked.

"About two months now. I also know I'm carrying twins." she replied.

"Well Takeshi, looks like you've got quite the burden now. I'm proud of you." Kakashi said, putting a hand on my shoulder. I looked back at him.

"Thanks dad." I said.

1111111111111111111.content:
Takeshi & Ino's apartment

(Takeshi's POV)

Three months later, Ino and I were now officially husband and wife. After Ino revealed she was carrying our children both her family and Kakashi agreed that it was best to have the wedding quickly, to avoid a scandal. We'd also moved into a luxury apartment near the Hokage building, thanks to my generous pay. Being Sannin does have its perks, after all.

Currently, I was busy cleaning my swords. Although having six swords that can combine is incredibly versatile, it can be pain sometimes.

"Takeshi! Come here quickly!" Ino shouted from the living room. I immediately dropped what I was doing (not literally) and ran in. Surprisingly all I found was Ino sitting on the couch, a hand on her bare belly, which by now was visibly growing.

"What's the emergency?" I asked, kneeling in front of her.

"The babies are kicking." she replied, placing my hand on her stomach. Suddenly, there it was; a tiny thump against my hand. Then another. I was speechless, so much emotion flowing through my mind to speak. After a few more minutes, I stood up and sat down next to Ino. She immediately wrapped her arms around me, snuggling closer, being careful of her extra size. I embraced her back, slowly carressing her belly.
1111111111111111111.title: A Tiny Miracle.

11111111111111111111.content:
Leaf Village Hospital, 6 months later

(Takeshi's POV)

Six months later, Ino and were relaxing on the balcony, when her water suddenly broke. Despite the fact that I was near panic, I managed to get her to the hospital quickly, where Sakura came and helped us to a room. Currently, Ino's contraction were coming about every five or six minutes, indicating she was getting close. She was panting slightly from the pain of the contractions, her forehead covered in a thin film of sweat. I was kneeling beside the bed, holding her hand, while Sakura was waiting to tell Ino to start pushing. Naruto, Kakashi and Ino's family were outside, waiting for any news. Her parents had visited briefly a few minutes ago, giving their daughter some emotional support.

"Okay Ino, you're almost fully dilated now. You'll be able to start pushing soon." Sakura told us.

"Takeshi, I...I'm scared." Ino said, looking at me. I smiled back.

"Don't worry, you'll be fine. I'm here for you." I replied.

"Okay Ino, when I say now, push as hard as you can, alright?" Sakura asked. Ino nodded briefly.

"Okay...NOW!" Sakura shouted. Ino pushed, screaming in pain, her hand clenching mine. I grunted from her sudden burst of strength.

"I can see the head! Once more...NOW!" Sakura said. Ino pushed again, her screams intensifying. Suddenly, I heard a baby's cry, along with Sakura's gasp.

"Congratulations you two! Looks like we've got a healthy baby boy here!" she told us. I looked at Ino happily, just before she felt another sharp contraction. Sakura cut the umbilical cord and handed our son over to another nurse, then got ready for the second baby.

"Okay Ino...NOW!" she shouted. Ino again pushed with all her strength, crying out in pain. I almost screamed myself, her grip became so strong.

"One more time...NOW!" Sakura said. Inmo pushed once more, screaming even louder if possible. I couldn't imagine the pain she was in right now, but I was so proud that she wasn't letting it stop her. Once again, I heard the wonderful sound of a baby crying, as Sakura cut the umbilical cord of our second child.

"And it's a girl!" she said, handing our daughter over to the nurse again. The babies were cleaned up as Ino fell back from exhaustion, panting heavily. I smiled, wiping the sweat off her forehead.

"You did Ino. I'm so proud of you." I told her. She looked to me with untold joy in her eyes, completey drained of energy. A few minutes later, Sakura came back holding two small bundles in her arms, one blue and the other pink.

"Here you go, you two. Two healthy kids." she said handing the two babies to Ino. Ino took them in her arms, gazing at the two babies with what I could only describe as a mother's love. The boy had some slight blonde hair, slightly more vivid than Ino's while the girl had some faint black hair like mine. I was surprised to notice that both babies' hair had a slight silvery sheen to it. I made a mental note to ask Sephiroth about that later on.

"They're so beautiful." she whispered. I gently patted her arm, watching my children sleep. I looked up to see everyone else coming into the room. Ino's parents rushed to the other side of the bed, kneeling beside their daughter.

"Well done, dear. They're both gorgeous." her mother said, while her father smiled.

"So, any thoughts on their names?" Sakura asked. Everyone else looked at us, clearly thinking the same thing. Ino and I looked to each other. We'd actually been discussing names before she went into labour, and we'd decided on what we'd choose.

"The boy's name is Shiro, and the girl is Tsubaki." Itold them, knowing Ino was still worn out.

"Those're lovely names." Ino's mother said.

"Takeshi, you want to hold shiro?" Ino asked. I nodded, as she placed the sleeping form in my arms.

"Here...just support his head." she told me. I shifted so that I was holding Shiro the same way she was holding Tsubaki. I felt an overwhelming love as I looked down at the baby in my arms. My son. Suddenly, I felt my mind get pulled somewhere else. I found myself standing in a large cave, with Sephiroth standing next to me.

"Sephiroth, what's going on?" I asked.

"I don't know, Takeshi." he replied. Then, a man wearing a red coat and holding a red-bladed sword appeared in front of us (http://images1.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20...).

"Who are you?" I asked.

"I am Genesis. The demon spirit that dwells within your son." the man replied.

"Genesis, it's been a while." Sephiroth said.

"It has, my friend. I see Taksehi and you have worked well together. I hope I can do the same with Shiro." Genesis replied.

"Wait, so are you two related in any way?" I asked, confused.

"In a way, yes. Sephiroth and myself have always been tied to each other. So it makes sense that, because Sephiroth manifested himself inside you, that I would manifest in your son." Genesis explained. "Now then, I'll let you get back to your friends. Farewell." As he said this, I found myself back in the hospital room, still holding Shiro. I decided to mention Genesis later. Suddenly, Shiro yawned quietly, before opening his golden eyes, which also had slight blue flecks. He gazed up at me as I gazed down at him.

"Hey Shiro, I'm your daddy." I said, tickling his cheek. Shiro giggled, grabbing my finger with his tiny hand. I sighed, amazed at how far I'd come since I first arrived in the village five years ago.

The story begins just after Naruto returns to the Hidden Leaf village after two years. In his absence, a new ninja named Takeshi has joined the village, but Tsunade has kept this fact a secret from most of the village, except for a few of the Jounin.

Takeshi
Age: 16 years old.
Height: 170cm.
Hair: Black, short, slightly covers left eye.
Eyes: Golden (turn almost fluorescent blue-green when using Sephiroth's chakra).
Build: Athletic, but muscular.
Specialities: Taijutsu, Ninjutsu, Sword Combat.
Kekkei Genkai: Kousokudo (The Speed of Light).
Personality: Normally quite laid back and friendly, cool, calm and collected in battle, cares greatly for his friends.
Weapons: 4 foot broadsword, later 5 foot buster sword.
Also posseses the demon spirit Sephiroth, 10 times as powerful as the Nine Tailed Fox.
